title: How to Remove Locations from Instagram Photos

steps.headline: Open the Instagram app.
steps.description: It’s an app resembling a multicolored camera.

steps.headline: Tap the Profile icon.
steps.description: It’s in the bottom-right corner of the screen. It may appear as your profile picture or the gray outline of a person.

steps.headline: Tap the three dots.
steps.description: They’re above the right corner of the picture. They will be horizontal for the iPhone and vertical for the Android.

steps.headline: Tap the location.
steps.description: It will be below your username. Locations are not automatically added when you post a photo, so there may not be a location to remove from the photo.

steps.headline: Tap Done.
steps.description: The location that the photo was taken will no longer be seen when your photo is viewed. This wikiHow will show you how to prevent Instagram from using your location altogether.

text: Open the Instagram app. It’s an app resembling a multicolored camera. Tap the Profile icon. It’s in the bottom-right corner of the screen. It may appear as your profile picture or the gray outline of a person. Tap a photo.  Tap the three dots. They’re above the right corner of the picture. They will be horizontal for the iPhone and vertical for the Android. Tap Edit.  Tap the location. It will be below your username. Locations are not automatically added when you post a photo, so there may not be a location to remove from the photo. Tap Remove Location.  Tap Done. The location that the photo was taken will no longer be seen when your photo is viewed. This wikiHow will show you how to prevent Instagram from using your location altogether.
